intro: Cerbera linnaei, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with simple, ovate leaves. Its bark is thick and fibrous, and it produces small, round fruits that contain toxic seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some parts of the world.
